title: GOP fundraiser says he got millions to illegally lobby Trump administration
description: Elliott Broidy, who was pardoned by Trump, testified about his failed attempts to quash a federal investigation of a Malaysian financier, during the trial of former Fugees member Prakazrel “Pras” Michél.

title: Indigenous anti-mining activist found slain in Mexico
description: An indigenous anti-mining activist has been killed in a violent part of western Mexico

title: Strong quake rattles Panama's coast; no reports of damage
description: A strong 6.3-magnitude earthquake has struck off Panama’s Pacific coast near the town of Boca Chica

title: Puerto Rico, USVI to receive $108M to upgrade water systems
description: The U.S. Environmental Protection Agency says Puerto Rico and the U.S. Virgin Islands will receive a total of nearly $108 million to improve drinking water infrastructure across the U.S. territories

title: Nigel Lawson, who shook up British economy in Thatcher era, dies at 91
description: Nigel Lawson supported Brexit and dismissed worries over climate change.

title: Queen Camilla: Charles’ wife gets title on coronation invite
description: King Charles III’s wife has been officially identified as Queen Camilla for the first time, with Buckingham Palace using the title on invitations for the monarch’s May 6 coronation

title: Himalayan avalanche kills seven tourists in northern India
description: At least seventeen were injured and seven killed, including one six-year-old girl, in an avalanche that struck the scenic, high-altitude Nathu La mountain pass near India's border with Tibet.

title: U.S. to boost Ukraine’s air defenses with new weapons package
description: The Biden administration said its new military aid package will include laser-guided rockets and gun trucks designed to take on enemy drones.

title: Politician gets house arrest in Dominican corruption case
description: A judge in the Dominican Republic on Tuesday ordered an ex-presidential candidate held under house arrest and two former high-ranking officials jailed while awaiting trial in a record $347 million embezzlement case

title: UN: Afghan female staff banned from work in eastern province
description: U.N. officials say that female Afghan employees of the United Nations have been banned from working by Taliban authorities in eastern Afghanistan

title: Killings in Mexican resort of Cancun tied to drug rivalries
description: Mexican authorities say the killings of four men in the resort of Cancun is probably related to drug gang rivalries

title: Greece's opposition vows to legalize same-sex marriage
description: The leader of Greece’s opposition has promised to legalize same-sex marriage with full parental rights if he wins a general election next month, in a move that would make it the first predominantly Orthodox Christian country to do so

title: Mexico complains to China about US pressure over fentanyl
description: Mexico’s president has asked his Chinese counterpart for help in halting chemicals from China used by Mexican drug dealers to illegally produce fentanyl, while also complaining of “rude” U.S. pressure to curb the drug trade

title: Prison not ‘appropriate’ for man who raped girl, judge says
description: Sean Hogg, who was found guilty of raping a 13-year-old girl in a Scotland park when he was 17, will get community service and not prison after a judge's ruling.

title: At least 10 students abducted by gunmen in northwest Nigeria
description: State authorities said Tuesday at least 10 students were abducted by gunmen in northwest Nigeria

title: Greek minister makes rare visit to Turkey as tensions ease
description: Turkey’s defense minister says NATO members Turkey and Greece can resolve their disputes through peaceful means and dialogue

title: Philippines warns of possible waves after offshore quake
description: A strong offshore earthquake has jolted eastern Philippine provinces and seismologists have warned villagers living by the sea to stay away from the coast because it could generate waves of less than a meter (3 feet) in height

title: Israel holding over 1,000 without charge, most since 2003
description: An Israeli human rights group says that Israel is holding over 1,000 Palestinian detainees without charge or trial, the highest number since 2003

title: South African opposition protests Uganda's anti-LGBTQ bill
description: More than 200 protesters in South Africa have demonstrated at the Uganda High Commission against the anti-gay bill recently passed by Ugandan lawmakers

title: Albania hosts forum promoting regional tourism
description: Albania is hosting an international forum aimed at promoting sustainable tourism as a main source of revenue

title: Belarus drops charges against Polish minority activist
description: A prominent Polish minority activist has been released from custody in Belarus after the authorities dropped criminal charges against her

title: Light, sound show transforms Berlin museum's exhibits
description: A new light and sound installation by British contemporary artist Liam Gillick is transforming one of Berlin’s most popular museums

title: Russian businessman back after fleeing house arrest in Italy
description: A Russian businessman who made a daring escape from house arrest in Italy where he was nabbed on a U.S. warrant for breaching Western sanctions has surfaced in Russia

title: Ex-Kosovo president tells international judges he's innocent
description: Former Kosovo president Hashim Thaci has insisted he is an innocent man as he addressed a panel of international judges hearing his trial on 10 counts of war crimes and crimes against humanity

title: Foreign veterinarians visit ailing elephant in Pakistani zoo
description: Foreign veterinarians have visited a sickly elephant at a southern Pakistani zoo amid widespread concern over her well-being and living conditions, One vet says her chances of surviving are unclear

title: New images from inside Fukushima reactor spark safety worry
description: Images captured by a robotic probe inside one of the three melted reactors at the tsunami-wrecked Fukushima nuclear power plant have shown exposed steel bars in the main supporting structure and parts of its thick external concrete wall missing

title: DNA: Woman was on famed 17th century Swedish warship
description: A U.S. military laboratory has helped Swedes confirm that a woman was on a 17th century warship that sank on its maiden voyage in the Stockholm harbor

title: Avalanche sweeps away tourists in northeast India; 6 killed
description: Officials and news reports say nn avalanche has swept away a group of tourists in the Himalayas in northeastern India, killing at least six and injuring 11 others

title: Swedes arrest 5 suspected of terror, ties to Quran burning
description: Sweden’s domestic security agency says five men have been arrested on suspicion of aiding and abetting terrorist offenses

title: Pakistan court rules delay of provinces' votes unlawful
description: Pakistan’s Supreme Court has ruled that a decision to delay provincial elections was unconstitutional

title: EU lashes out at China for support of Russia in Ukraine war
description: The European Union’s foreign policy chief has lashed out at China for its support of Russia during the invasion of Ukraine and called it “a blatant violation” of Beijing’s United Nations commitments

title: As it turns 25, N Ireland’s Good Friday Agreement explained
description: It has been 25 years since the striking of the Good Friday Agreement, the landmark peace accord that ended three decades of violence in Northern Ireland, a period known as “the Troubles.”

title: Train derails in Netherlands, killing one and injuring 30
description: The train, which was traveling from the city of Leiden to The Hague, derailed in the village of Voorschoten, officials said.

title: Police: Palestinian stabs 2 Israelis near army base
description: Israeli police say a suspected Palestinian attacker stabbed two Israeli soldiers near an army base south of Tel Aviv on Tuesday in the latest incident in a yearlong spate of violence

title: Finland to join NATO today, doubling alliance’s land border with Russia
description: It is a historic shift for a country that once insisted it was safer without NATO membership and a sign of how Russia's war has reshaped European security.

title: Infertility affects 1 in 6 adults around the world, WHO says
description: The report highlighted the prevalence of infertility across regions and economic levels — and a need for more research and better access to reproductive care.

title: German climber killed in fall near Swiss resort of Zermatt
description: Police say a German climber has died after falling some 500 meters (1,640 feet) in the Alps in southern Switzerland

title: Finland set to join NATO, in blow to Putin
description: Finland is joining NATO

title: Afghan Taliban raid kills 6 members of Islamic State group
description: The Taliban says their forces in Afghanistan have killed six members of the extremist Islamic State group during a raid in the country’s north

title: Grassroots faith leaders navigate a Northern Ireland in flux
description: Twenty-five years ago, the Good Friday Agreement halted much of the violence of Northern Ireland’s Troubles

title: Grassroots faith leaders navigate a Northern Ireland in flux
description: Twenty-five years ago, the Good Friday Agreement halted much of the violence of Northern Ireland’s Troubles

title: Ukraine live briefing: Finland set to join NATO; Zelensky to visit Poland
description: Finland’s accession will extend the trans-Atlantic military alliance’s reach to the far north of Europe and double its land border with Russia.

title: 1 dead, several injured in train crash near The Hague
description: One person has died and some 30 passengers are injured, many of them seriously, after a train partially derailed near the Dutch city of The Hague

title: Gunmen kill 2 police in northwest Pakistan
description: Militants in Pakistan shot at the country’s police force in a volatile northwestern province overnight, killing two officers

title: US military says senior IS commander killed in Syria
description: The United States military says a drone strike carried out by the U.S.-led coalition in northwestern Syria has killed a senior member of the Islamic State group who was in charge of planning attacks in Europe, The man killed Monday in the strike was identified by a U.S. military statement as Khalid Aydd Ahmad al-Jbouri

title: How Finland went from neutral to NATO
description: Russia's invasion of Ukraine prompted formerly wary countries like Finland and Sweden to choose a side.

title: Trump’s saga is part of a wider global ‘age of impunity’
description: A recent ranking of countries by levels of impunity found the United States in the middle of the pack, far behind many of its peers in the West.
